# GenePair: Statistical Methods for Modeling Spatially-Referenced Paired Genetic Relatedness Data

## Trans_Prob_Example

[1] Simulate data from the proposed model:

* Setting the reproducibility seed and initializing packages for data simulation: 
```{r}
set.seed(2412)

library(GenePair)  
library(mnormt)  #Multivariate normal distribution
```

* Setting the global data values:
```{r}
n<-100  #Number of individuals
n_star<-0  #Number of paired responses
for(j in 1:n){
   for(k in 1:n){
      n_star<-n_star + 
              1
      }
   }
n_star<-n_star - 
        n

#Unique locations (one for each individual)
locs<-matrix(runif((2*n), 
                   min = -1.00, 
                   max =  1.00),  
             nrow = n,
             ncol = 2)
plot(locs)
v<-diag(n)

spatial_dists<-as.matrix(dist(locs,
                              diag = TRUE,
                              upper = TRUE))

#x_pair
x_pair<-matrix(1, 
               nrow = n_star, 
               ncol = 2) 
x<-rnorm(n = n)
counter<-1
for(j in 1:n){
   for(k in 1:n){
      if(j != k){
        
        x_pair[counter, 2]<-abs(x[j] - x[k])
        counter<-counter +
                 1
        
        }
      }
   }
x_pair[,2]<-scale(x_pair[,2])

#x_ind_g, x_ind_r
x1<-rnorm(n = n)
x2<-rnorm(n = n)
x_ind_g<-matrix(1, 
                nrow = n_star, 
                ncol = 2) 
x_ind_r<-matrix(1, 
                nrow = n_star, 
                ncol = 2)
counter<-1
for(j in 1:n){
   for(k in 1:n){
      if(j != k){
 
        x_ind_g[counter, 1]<-x1[j]
        x_ind_g[counter, 2]<-x2[j]
        x_ind_r[counter, 1]<-x1[k]
        x_ind_r[counter, 2]<-x2[k]
        counter<-counter +
                 1
        
        }
      }
   }
x_ind_g<-scale(x_ind_g)
x_ind_r<-scale(x_ind_r)

#z_g, z_r
z_g<-matrix(0, 
            nrow = n_star, 
            ncol = n)
z_r<-matrix(0, 
            nrow = n_star, 
            ncol = n)
counter<-1
for(j in 1:n){
   for(k in 1:n){
      if(j != k){
         
        z_g[counter, j]<-1
        z_r[counter, k]<-1
        counter<-counter +
                 1
        
        }
      }
   }
```

* Setting the values for the statistical model parameters:
```{r}
beta_true<- c(1.00, 
              -0.30)
gamma_true<-c(2.10,
              -1.75,
              0.00)

tau2_true<-2.00
sigma2_zeta_true<-0.01

phi_true<-5.00
Sigma_true<-tau2_true*exp(-phi_true*spatial_dists)
eta_true<-rmnorm(n = 1, 
                 mean = rep(0.00, 
                            times = n), 
                 varcov = Sigma_true)

theta_true<-eta_true +
            rnorm(n = n,
                  mean = 0.00,
                  sd = sqrt(sigma2_zeta_true))
theta_true<-theta_true -
            mean(theta_true)

mu_true<-x_pair%*%beta_true +
         x_ind%*%gamma_true +
         z%*%theta_true

sigma2_epsilon_true<-0.10
log_patristic_distances<-mu_true +
                         rnorm(n = n_star,
                               mean = 0.00,
                               sd = sqrt(sigma2_epsilon_true))

hist(log_patristic_distances)
```

[2] Apply the Patristic Function within the GenePair Package:

```{r echo=TRUE}
results<-Patristic(mcmc_samples = 20000,
                   log_patristic_distances =  log_patristic_distances, 
                   x_pair = x_pair, 
                   x_ind = x_ind, 
                   z = z, 
                   spatial_dists = spatial_dists,
                   v = v,
                   metrop_var_phi_trans = 0.75)
```

[3]  Analyzing Output:

```{r}
#Compare random effects
plot(rowMeans(results$theta[,10001:20000]),
     theta_true)
abline(0,1)

#Compare \beta
round(rowMeans(results$beta[,10001:20000]), 2)
round(beta_true, 2)

#Compare \gamma
round(rowMeans(results$gamma[,10001:20000]), 2)
round(gamma_true, 2)

#Compare \sigma2_epsilon
round(mean(results$sigma2_epsilon[10001:20000]), 2)
sigma2_epsilon_true
```
